channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘They ain’t worried about the miners or people in West Virginia or coal miners anywhere’: Black lung sufferers despair over DC’s distance
item.description: The two reddest states in America — Wyoming and West Virginia — had the highest overall worker death rates in 2023, according to government figures.

item.title: Trump ‘failed to consider the harms’ on SNAP benefits by withholding food aid during shutdown, judge rules
item.description: Find the money to fully fund SNAP benefits for November, the judge told the White House, which promptly appealed.

item.title: The Fed’s Recent Rate Decisions Have Been Divisive. It Is Likely to Get Worse.
item.description: The last three policy votes have featured some form of dissent, as officials grapple with how to weigh a softening labor market and resurgent inflatio...

item.title: Trump’s Tariffs Scar Canadian City Where Cars Have Been Made for Decades
item.description: An automaker’s decision to shift Canadian jobs to the United States has left workers in Brampton, Ontario, feeling betrayed and angry.

item.title: Mamdani Wants to Tax the Rich. Can He Persuade State Leaders?
item.description: After an impressive victory, Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani now must find funds for his programs. His push for higher taxes puts Gov. Kathy Hochul, who fa...

item.title: ‘You can’t expect people to go in to work when they’re not getting a paycheck’: Travelers sympathize despite 800 downed Friday flights
item.description: The 40 airports selected for the slowdown span over two dozen states and include hubs such as Atlanta, Dallas, Denver, LA and Charlotte.

item.title: San Francisco Sees Nancy Pelosi as a Tireless Leader for the City
item.description: Representative Nancy Pelosi, after announcing her retirement, was praised by many San Franciscans for her tireless efforts on behalf of the city. Some...

item.title: Trump cozies up to Central Asian leaders in hunt for rare earths resources
item.description: Trump and the officials from Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan and Uzbekistan held bilateral meetings in the Oval Office.

item.title: Zohran Mamdani visits Puerto Rico for annual NYC political power broker summit
item.description: The conference is something of a post-Election Day retreat for the state’s political movers and shakers at a Hilton hotel in San Juan.

item.title: More Democrats Need to Follow Pelosi’s Example and Retire
item.description: She has shown herself more willing than most to put aside her own ego for the greater good.

item.title: Fatos Nano, Albanian Leader in Era of Chaos and Transition, Dies at 73
item.description: A consummate political survivor during his country’s shift from brutal communist regime to flawed democracy, he served three stints as prime minister.

item.title: Serbian Lawmakers Approve Luxury Trump Hotel on Historic Bombing Site
item.description: Despite a fraud investigation into officials who endorsed the project, Parliament used an extraordinary provision in the Constitution to push the plan...

item.title: Russian Sanctions Risk Straining Trump’s Chummy Relationship With Hungarian Leader
item.description: New U.S. penalties on Russian energy could be a sticking point as President Trump and Prime Minister Viktor Orban of Hungary meet.

item.title: 4 Arrested Over Disruption of Israeli Orchestra’s Concert
item.description: Several audience members shouted or lit flares as the Israel Philharmonic Orchestra performed in Paris. After the concert, the ensemble received 10 mi...

item.title: Trump’s Tariffs Scar Canadian City Where Cars Have Been Made for Decades
item.description: An automaker’s decision to shift Canadian jobs to the United States has left workers in Brampton, Ontario, feeling betrayed and angry.
